ThingDef.label: animal Implant: bear leg (tier 1)
ThingDef.description: A prosthetic animal leg strengthened with bear muscles, and ending in a powerful bear claw that adds a powerful melee attack.

ThingDef.label: animal Implant: lizard leg (tier 2)
ThingDef.description: A bionic animal leg reinforced with tough lizard skin.

ThingDef.label: animal Implant: thrumbo leg (tier 3)
ThingDef.description: A bionic animal leg reinforced with muscle tissue from a powerful thrumbo.

ThingDef.label: animal Implant: scyther tail (tier 2)
ThingDef.description: A scyther tail created by attaching a scyther blade to an animal's tail. Note that only creatures with a natural tail can use this.

ThingDef.label: animal Implant: mechanoid tail (tier 3)
ThingDef.description: An advanced mechanoid tail, even more powerful than the old scyther tail. Note that only creatures with a natural tail can use this.

ThingDef.label: animal Implant: canid eye (tier 1)
ThingDef.description: An eye implant that uses genetic splicing with canid genes to give an old (or damaged) eye decent vision. This implant is not meant to replace healthy eyes.

ThingDef.label: animal Implant: insectile eye (tier 2)
ThingDef.description: A bionic implant which gives the creature compound insectile eyes. Compared with simple eyes, compound eyes possess a very large view angle, and can detect fast movement.

ThingDef.label: animal Implant: bionic thrumbo eye (tier 3)
ThingDef.description: A bionic eye reinforced with specialized photoreceptors from a powerful thrumbo.

ThingDef.label: animal Implant: rodent ear (tier 1)
ThingDef.description: An ear implant that uses genetic splicing with rodent genes to give an old (or damaged) ear decent hearing. This implant is not meant to replace healthy ears.

ThingDef.label: animal Implant: moth tympanal organ (tier 2)
ThingDef.description: A bionic implant adding a moth tympanal organ to the creature's ear. Moths can hear sounds of a higher frequency than any bat can produce.

ThingDef.label: animal Implant: mechanoid auditory receptors (tier 3)
ThingDef.description: These mechanoid auditory receptors can scan a really wide band of frequencies.

ThingDef.label: animal Implant: rodent nose (tier 1)
ThingDef.description: An implant that uses genetic splicing with rodent genes to give an old (or damaged) nose decent smelling. This implant is not meant to replace healthy noses. Can't be installed on birds and insects.

ThingDef.label: animal Implant: pheromone receivers (tier 2)
ThingDef.description: An implant that uses genetic splicing with alien insectoid genes to give the ability to detect pheromones, thus improving the olfactory system. Can't be installed on birds and (ironically) insects.

ThingDef.label: animal Implant: miniature thrumbo horn (tier 3)
ThingDef.description: A bionic implant adding a small thrumbo horn where the creature's nose used to be. This implant acts as a nose, allowing the creature to breathe and smell, and can be used by the creature in melee. Birds, insects, and creatures that already have a thrumbo horn don't have enough space on their skull to install this implant.

ThingDef.label: animal Implant: wolf jaws (tier 1)
ThingDef.description: An implant that uses genetic splicing with wolf genes to give an old (or damaged) jaw decent functioning. This implant is not meant to replace healthy jaws.

ThingDef.label: animal Implant: insect mandibles (tier 2)
ThingDef.description: A bionic implant adding insect mandibles to the creature's face. Insect mandibles improve manipulation and eating, while also working as an offesive weapon

ThingDef.label: animal Implant: bionic thrumbo jaws (tier 3)
ThingDef.description: A bionic implant adding thrumbo jaws to the creature's mouth. These creatures devour trees, so you can imagine their jaws are up to the task.

ThingDef.label: animal Implant: muffalo spine (tier 1)
ThingDef.description: A spine implant that uses genetic splicing with muffalo genes to give an old (or damaged) spine decent functioning. This implant is not meant to replace healthy spines.

ThingDef.label: animal Implant: crocodile spine (tier 2)
ThingDef.description: A bionic implant adding a sturdy crocodile spine to the creature's skeletal system.

ThingDef.label: animal Implant: mechanoid spine (tier 3)
ThingDef.description: A bionic implant adding a plasteel structure with active mechanites to the creature's skeletal system.

ThingDef.label: animal Implant: chicken brains (tier 1)
ThingDef.description: An implant that uses chicken brain tissue to patch damaged neurological pathways. This implant is intended for brain-dead creatures.

ThingDef.label: animal Implant: monitor lizard brain (tier 2)
ThingDef.description: A bionic implant using monitor lizard brain tissue. This highly intelligent reptile has very quick reflexes.

ThingDef.label: animal Implant: bionic thrumbo brain (tier 3)
ThingDef.description: A bionic brain implant using thrumbo neural tissue. Superb intelligence and reflexes.

ThingDef.label: animal Implant: boomalope heart (tier 1)
ThingDef.description: An implant that uses chemfuel to pump blood through the animal's body. This implant is intended for creatures whose heart is failing catastrophically, since it is less efficient than a natural heart.

ThingDef.label: animal Implant: chitinous heart (tier 2)
ThingDef.description: A bionic heart implant using a reinforced shell of insectoid chitin for protection. This is a heart designed to take a beating. Pun intended, but it's the last one, I promise .

ThingDef.label: animal Implant: mechanoid heart (tier 3)
ThingDef.description: A bionic heart strengthened by the action of active mechanites.

ThingDef.label: animal Implant: muffalo lung (tier 1)
ThingDef.description: An implant that uses muffalo genes to increase breathing capacity.

ThingDef.label: animal Implant: bear liver (tier 1)
ThingDef.description: An implant that uses bear genes to improve function of the liver. Specially useful for those alcoholic chickens.

ThingDef.label: animal Implant: chicken kidney (tier 1)
ThingDef.description: An implant that uses chicken genes to improve function of the kidney. Birds have large kidneys. Yep, you learned that today.

ThingDef.label: animal Implant: boomalope stomach (tier 1)
ThingDef.description: An implant that uses boomalope genes to improve function of the stomach.

ThingDef.label: human Implant: bear claws
ThingDef.description: An improvement over the bionic Power Claw, these claws have been vat-grown with a mixture of human and bear DNA, and replace the subject's hand with versatile, non-retractable claws.

ThingDef.label: human Implant: ovipositor
ThingDef.description: You know you have gone too far in your scientific experiments when you are implanting a human being with an ovipositor. This will enable the colonist to lay chicken eggs twice a day. It hurts as hell, though. Also, yuck.

ThingDef.label: human Implant: muffalo strengthened muscles
ThingDef.description: By weaving muffalo muscle strands with the subjects muscular system, strength, resilience and carrying capacity are greatly increased.

ThingDef.label: human Implant: muffalo mammaries
ThingDef.description: By implanting muffalo mammaries into a colonist... Wait, what??? Who came up with this idea????? Anyway... this implant allows your colonist to be milked... Ugh, I give up.

ThingDef.label: human Implant: boomalope nodules
ThingDef.description: These skin nodules can be integrated in a human's torso, causing a huge explosion if the subjects dies violently.

ThingDef.label: human Implant: wolf muscular fibers
ThingDef.description: The subjects legs can be modified by weaving hybrid human/wolf muscle fibers within the base tissue, giving her a significant strength and speed boost.

ThingDef.label: human Implant: bunny ears
ThingDef.description: These huge leporid ears give amazing enhanced hearing. Also, super kawaii!

ThingDef.label: human Implant: insectoid antennae
ThingDef.description: These hybrid humanoid / insectoid feeling appendages can be implanted in a subject's head, completely modifying the way the subject "sees" and feels the surrounding world. The experience may be slightly overwhelming due to sensorial overload.

ThingDef.label: human Implant: thrumbo horn
ThingDef.description: A genetically modified thrumbo horn that can be implanted in a subject's forehead. Nasty.

ThingDef.label: human Implant: venomous fangs
ThingDef.description: This hybrid implant substitutes the subject's jaw with a set of venomous fangs. Useful in combat, but not very comfortable.
